thread.title: Sydney to be smashed by another big storm
thread.title_full: Sydney to be smashed by another big storm

title: Sydney to be smashed by another big storm
text: Huge hail is falling across Sydney on Saturday afternoon as the storm batters the coast Huge golf ball sized hail fell across Sydney as more than 10,000 homes are still without power Storm clouds roll over the Sydney Harbour on Saturday afternoon An ominous storm is approaching Sydney and the Central Coast Thunderstorms are expected in Sydney, the Central Tablelands and Southern Tablelands on Saturday. Sydneysiders can expect more of the same on Sunday with a 90 per cent chance of rain in the morning and afternoon, with a max of 25 degrees. However, things will clear up on Monday through to Thursday, before more rain on Friday. Ausgrid spokeswoman Phillipa Wheeler said power would not return to some homes until tomorrow. 'This is a major storm event for our network area and the damage is extensive â€” they're restoring the major power lines first,' she told the ABC . Hail smashes homes in Sydney and across the Central Coast as storms continue from Friday Thunderstorms will batter the New South Wales coast on Saturday FIVE DAY FORECAST Sunday: Max 25, possible storms Monday: Max 20, sunny Tuesday: Max 26, possible shower Wednesday: Max 28, mostly sunny Thursday: Max 30, mostly sunny Sunday: Max 35, mostly sunny Monday: Max 25, partly cloudy Tuesday: Max 23, cloudy Wednesday: Max 25, partly cloudy Thursday: Max 29, sunny Sunday: Max 19, partly cloudy Monday: Max 21, cloudy Tuesday: Max 27, mostly sunny Wednesday: Max 32, sunny
